column4: i have booted from livecd ubuntu 10.04 and apt-get install openssh-server
which is default passwords for root and ubuntu?
there is no default password for root
mkaay: ssh 192.168.1.52 -lroot no pass => login error
what happens when you do that as user 'ubuntu'?
i used sudo -s then passwd ubuntu
ant then login ower ssh - everything is ok
you can do the same with root, if you must
yes, but is strange that i cant google any default pass eg root test ubuntu
the fresh install is such that the 'root' password is disabled (or is not set whatever way you see it)
hence I am not suprised by what you are observing
